CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, March 11, 1961, pg. 14A, reads: "D.I. Models who made the annual benefit style show and dance a fascinating evening at Holiday House just outside of Pittsburgh, show the winning ways that turned hundreds of guests into delighted patrons..Merelene [Marlene] Thomas, a stunning one...The nine hand-picked models showed the famous DuPont collection, which is created each year just for the National Foundation (March of Dimes). The D.I.'s headed by Gay DeHall, have as their sole project the National Foundation, and they plan to sponsor the Ebony Show in September. - Harris Photos"
TitMainTitle: Portrait of MereleneThomas wearing dark dress with textured bodice and three strand beaded necklace, seated on table looking at magazine, posed in front of light colored curtain in Holiday House for the D.I. Club annual benefit for National Foundation
CatSubject_tab: Clothing and dress--Pennsylvania--Monroeville.Women--Pennsylvania--Monroeville.Jewelry--Pennsylvania--Monroeville.Delightfully Insane Club Inc.Holiday House (Monroeville, Pa).Charities--Pennsylvania--Monroeville.
